column4: I can't seem to get my apache set up with virtual hosts, if I want the url to be http://localhost/vhost what directive do I use?
lol what?
vhosts allows for different settings to be applied given the hostname found in the http request
the hostname is the part between :// and the next /
but doesn't ServerName and ServerAlias need to be set in the vhost file?
so in your example, the hostname is localhost
ah so would I need to create a subdirectory?
apache is not very particular about in what file you set that up in, as long as it gets included by another configuration file that gets loaded
no, vhosts have nothing to do with directories or subdirectories. you'd never put a configuration file (except .htaccess) under a directory accessible to the public anyhow
http://eregie.premier-ministre.gouv.fr/manual/vhosts/name-based.html
thanks, but in that example it says ServerName www.domain.tld
yes, what are you trying to say?
I'm just not sure what I need to set mine to, it seems like an important setting but maybe I'm confused
the purpose of vhosts is so that you can access the server using different host names and get different data
why do you want vhosts?
I want to set up separate development environments for a few different websites and this seemed to make sense
i also probably would question using ubuntu as a server system
well this is more to make sure my code is working than anything else but I see your point
what sort of technology are you developing atop?
one wordpress site, one regular php-based site and playing with facebook development and python

ah, ok, well i recommend giving the apache manual a thorough reading. it's been a long time for me, so i'm very rusty, but i seem to recall becoming pretty proficient at it after reading a few manual sections about vhosts.
when I get my new computer up I'll probably have something besides ubuntu running that can better serve as a server
